dismissalText.commentary: Niroshan Dickwella b Phehlukwayo 69 (78b 10x4 0x6) SR: 88.46

dismissalComment.html: played on! How often does Dickwella get out that way? Loose ball outside off, and Dickwella goes for the cut way too early. The ball hits the bottom of the bat, and drags this onto his off stump. Phehlulkwayo celebrates hard and Dickwella cuts a forlorn look as he makes his way back for 69

dismissalComment.html: deceived! Knuckleball full on middle, and Lakmal does not pick it up at all. Tries to work this towards the leg side, but the ball arrives late, hits his front leg, and then ricochets onto middle stump. Good bye!

headshotImage.caption: Lungi Ngidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lungi Ngidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: WU Tharanga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: WU Tharanga headshot

dismissalComment.html: After two gorgeous boundaries, Tharanga has nicked off. How many times have you seen that? Short and waaay wide outside off, Tharanga goes after it, flashes, and only under-edges it behind to de Kock. Early lift for SA

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Two in two for Lungi. He pins Kusal Mendis in the crease and sends him back for a first-ball duck. This was nice and full, slanted in on middle, Kusal Mendis falls over the flick and is hit on the knee-roll of the front pad in line with middle. This would have taken out the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: NLTC Perera headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: NLTC Perera headshot

dismissalComment.html: short on middle, and Perera goes for a pull. Top-edges this, and de Kock has all the time in the world to get under it. Soft dismissal

dismissalText.commentary: Shehan Jayasuriya c †de Kock b Mulder 18 (27b 1x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: back of a length and floated down the leg side, Shehan aims a flick. Was there a deflection behind? Not given out caught behind by Paul Reiffel. SA review the on-field not-out decision. They're pretty confident they have their man. Ultra Edge detects a spike, and Shehan has to go. He can't get enough bat and feathers it behind

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c & b Dananjaya 49 (41b 3x4 2x6) SR: 119.51

dismissalComment.html: Akila in his last over has Faf chipping a return catch. Legbreak again from Akila. The length is short and this spins away outside off, Faf goes back, closes the face a bit early and sends a leading edge back to the bowler. No fifty for the SA captain again. Faf's scores this tour: 49,1,48,7,71,47, and now 49

headshotImage.caption: Akila Dananjaya
headshotImage.longCaption: Akila Dananjaya

headshotImage.caption: HM Amla headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: HM Amla headshot

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka have finally held onto a catch. Fine reflexes from Akila... or not. Amla races down the track, meets a full-toss, it was the attempted wrong'un from Akila, and stabs it back to Akila, who nearly lets the ball burst through. More relief than joy for him. Could this be the opening for SL?

commentTextItems.html: full outside off, and the square drive races away to the cover boundary! South Africa go 2-0 up

commentPostTextItems.html: 10.13pm That's all from us. Hope you enjoyed ESPNcricinfo's coverage of the second ODI. See you soon for game 3, but till then, this is Sreshth Shah signing off. Bye bye!

Faf du Plessis, the winning captain: These conditions are favourable a bit more. Batting second was going to be tricky, but pleased to see how we played. It was a good one-day wicket. But I'm very pleased at how we are chasing the game. We are staying positive, putting pressure on the opposition and so on. Excellent bowling effort by our boys, we kept pulling things back despite Mathews' knock. Planning and execution was good. My mental focus is on being positive, and I'm not thinking of the lack of fifties personally."

Angelo Mathews, the losing captain: "We gave away too many wickets up front. And then we lost wickets at crucial times too, so we never got going. We didn't hold on to catches as well, and while defending low scores, you need to hold on to every chance. We had a terrible day on the field. Neither did the bowlers bowl well. We were a bunch of schoolkids when it came to today's fielding. Dickwella's gone for a scan, but he should be okay. Akila is bowling brilliantly, so we do have some positives there. We are still alive in this series. My hands were tied in my knock, because we were losing wickets all the time, but pretty pleased on a personal note."

Quinton de Kock is the Man of the Match. He says: "Not sure what the secret to our success is. But yes, it's spinning less. Nice to know the work you're doing off the field is paying off. The last tour has been really difficult, and it's always challenging to bat in the Subcontinent. The pitch played the same all day. It was slower as the day progressed, but it was a similar pitch through the game."

9.56pm Smiles in the South African camp as they go 2-0 up in the five-game series. A forlorn look on Angelo Mathews and co. as they were outclassed for the second contest in a row. Back to the drawing board for them as the visitors have been better batsmen, bowlers and definitely better fielders than the hosts. The pacers set the game up today, but de Kock, Amla and du Plessis ensured it was a trouble-free chase. See you in a few minutes for the presentation.

Elijah2800: "Had Sri Lanka been more discipline in the outfield, this came could of have a different result. Need to be more vigilant & back up the bowlers more with the world cup around the corner, with batsmem scoring double centries & soon triple centries in ODI ain't no room for dropping dollies."
Philip Mitra: "Make Lakmal captain, he is a lucky guy. Stats will confirm that."
Sinthujan: "Malinga's 4 in 4 come to my mind now."

commentTextItems.html: good length outside off, and flying over the bat's shoulder to the keeper
short on leg, and the pull goes to deep backward square leg for one
full on off but angling away from Phehlukwayo. Tries to drive over cover but misses out complelely

commentPostTextItems.html: Mafas: "SL also unlucky, I'm also unlucky, cricinfo never post my comments more than 7years since I start to comments :"

commentPreTextItems.html: Karthick: "At this point both SA and Eng scores are at 240/6"

commentTextItems.html: good length on middle, but angling down leg. Mulder simply flicks it along the ball's trajectory to fine leg

commentPostTextItems.html: Daniel F: "@Naman, i agree. But in the previous 5 world cups they were almost always marked as favourites and failed, so I don't think being somewhat short of being ready is all that bad. Maybe not being marked as favourites takes off a bit of pressure?"

commentTextItems.html: past the bat's outside edge again! Full outside off and turning away from the left-hander

commentPostTextItems.html: Sean T.: "The problem for Sri Lanka is at the top. Tharanga consistently falls early. A change with Kusal Mendis opening next game would be refreshing."

commentTextItems.html: reverse swept! But straight to short third man
full outside off, and straightening after pitching! Goes past the bat's outside edge as he looks to go for the big one
length ball on off, and he punches this with the spin to long on
full on off, and turning into his pads. Worked away to the leg side
length ball on off, but angling away from the batsman. He nudges it square on the leg side, but can't take the single

commentTextItems.html: length ball on middle, and too close to his body for the square cut. Mistimed to point

commentPostTextItems.html: Naman: "I'd say South Africa's bowling is about 80% ready for the World Cup, given everyone stays fit, but their batting is at a solid 30%. This batting lineup won't survive against an experienced bowling lineup. They need Amla, du Plessis and Miller to be in the forms of their lives to have a chance next year."

commentTextItems.html: full on middle, and Phehlukwayo brings out another front-footed defense. Played to the leg side on this occasion
length ball on off, and blocked off the front foot once again
full on middle, and defended to cover off the front foot
wide outside off, and cut way to deep point for one
tossed up, takes the pad and rolls away behind square

commentPostTextItems.html: That's it from me. Sreshth will take you home

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c & b Dananjaya 43 (43b 6x4 0x6) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka have finally held onto a catch. Fine reflexes from Akila... or not. Amla races down the track, meets a full-toss, it was the attempted wrong'un from Akila, and stabs it back to Akila, who nearly lets the ball burst through. More relief than joy for him. Could this be the opening for SL?

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Mendis b Lakmal 3 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Lakmal draws the outside edge, Kusal Mendis pouches it at slip. What're you doing, South Africa? Good length and shapes away outside off, Miller's front foot is nowhere near the pitch of the ball. He simply throws his bat at the ball and nicks it off to wide slip. That's the 100th ODI wicket for Lakmal

dismissalComment.html: full on leg stump, and that's been dispatched into the midwicket boundary. But oh dear, it's not off the bat's middle, and the delivery goes straight down the throat of Lakmal. Let the 'you-jinxed-it' comments come!

headshotImage.caption: Akila Dananjaya
headshotImage.longCaption: Akila Dananjaya

headshotImage.caption: HM Amla headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: HM Amla headshot

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka have finally held onto a catch. Fine reflexes from Akila... or not. Amla races down the track, meets a full-toss, it was the attempted wrong'un from Akila, and stabs it back to Akila, who nearly lets the ball burst through. More relief than joy for him. Could this be the opening for SL?

headshotImage.caption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Akila dupes Markram with the variation: a sharp legbreak. Tosses it up outside off, Markram uses his feet early, and prods at it, playing for the offbreak. The ball breaks away, catches the outside edge and Kusal Perera snaps up the catch

headshotImage.caption: F du Plessis headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: F du Plessis headshot

dismissalComment.html: Akila in his last over has Faf chipping a return catch. Legbreak again from Akila. The length is short and this spins away outside off, Faf goes back, closes the face a bit early and sends a leading edge back to the bowler. No fifty for the SA captain again. Faf's scores this tour: 49,1,48,7,71,47, and now 49

dismissalComment.html: and now JP has drilled a catch straight to short extra cover. He steps out, this is full and outside off, hit into the lap of Mendis. SA 14 away from victory. 150th ODI wicket for Thisara
